AddAccountToAccountGroup.document: This API is used to add an account to an account group.
AddAccountToAccountGroup.name: Adds account to account group

AddUserToUserGroup.document: This API is used to add a user to a user group.
AddUserToUserGroup.name: Adds user to user group

CreateAccountGroup.document: This API is used to create an account group.
CreateAccountGroup.name: Creates account group

CreateAppAccount.document: This API is used to create an application account.
CreateAppAccount.name: Creates application account

CreateOrgNode.document: This API is used to create an organization node.
CreateOrgNode.name: Creates organization node

CreateUser.document: This API is used to create a user.
CreateUser.name: Creates user

CreateUserGroup.document: This API is used to create a user group.
CreateUserGroup.name: Creates user group

DeleteAccountGroup.document: This API is used to delete an account group.
DeleteAccountGroup.name: Deletes account group

DeleteAppAccount.document: This API is used to delete an application account.
DeleteAppAccount.name: Deletes application account

DeleteOrgNode.document: This API is used to delete an organization node.
DeleteOrgNode.name: Deletes organization node

DeleteUser.document: This API is used to delete a user by username or user ID.
DeleteUser.name: Deletes user

DeleteUserGroup.document: This API is used to delete a user group.
DeleteUserGroup.name: Deletes user group

DeleteUsers.document: This API is used to batch delete the users under the current node. If an error occurs when a user is deleted, the deletion of other selected users will not be affected, and the username/ID of the user who fails to be deleted will be prompted.
DeleteUsers.name: Batch deletes users

DescribeAccountGroup.document: This API is used to query the list of account groups.
DescribeAccountGroup.name: Queries account group list

DescribeAppAccount.document: This API is used to query the list of application accounts.
DescribeAppAccount.name: Queries application account list

DescribeApplication.document: This API is used to get the information of an application.
DescribeApplication.name: Gets application information

DescribeOrgNode.document: This API is used to read the information of an organization node by organization node ID.
DescribeOrgNode.name: Reads organization node information

DescribePublicKey.document: This API is used to get the information of a JWT public key.
DescribePublicKey.name: Gets JWT public key information

DescribeUserGroup.document: This API is used to get the information of a user group.
DescribeUserGroup.name: Gets user group information

DescribeUserInfo.document: This API is used to search for a user by username or user ID.
DescribeUserInfo.name: Gets user information

DescribeUserResourcesAuthorization.document: This API is used to query the list of resource authorizations under the specified user.
DescribeUserResourcesAuthorization.name: Queries resource authorization list under specified user

DescribeUserThirdPartyAccountInfo.document: This API is used to get the third-party account binding information by username or user ID.
DescribeUserThirdPartyAccountInfo.name: Gets the third-party account binding information of user

ListAccountInAccountGroup.document: This API is used to get the list of accounts in an account group.
ListAccountInAccountGroup.name: Gets the list of accounts in account group

ListApplicationAuthorizations.document: This API is used to get the list of authorization relationships of an application (including search criteria-based match).
ListApplicationAuthorizations.name: Gets authorization relationship list of application

ListApplications.document: This API is used to get the list of applications.
ListApplications.name: Gets application list

ListAuthorizedApplicationsToOrgNode.document: This API is used to get the list of accessible applications by organization node ID.
ListAuthorizedApplicationsToOrgNode.name: Gets the list of applications accessible to organization node

ListAuthorizedApplicationsToUser.document: This API is used to get the list of accessible applications by user ID.
ListAuthorizedApplicationsToUser.name: Gets the list of applications accessible to user

ListAuthorizedApplicationsToUserGroup.document: This API is used to get the list of accessible applications by user group ID.
ListAuthorizedApplicationsToUserGroup.name: Gets the list of applications accessible to user group

ListUserGroups.document: This API is used to get the information of the user group list (including query conditions).
ListUserGroups.name: Gets user group list information

ListUserGroupsOfUser.document: This API is used to get the list of a user's user groups.
ListUserGroupsOfUser.name: Gets the list of user's user groups

ListUsers.document: This API is used to get the information of the user list.
ListUsers.name: Gets user list information

ListUsersInOrgNode.document: This API is used to read the users under an organization node by organization node ID.
ListUsersInOrgNode.name: Reads users under node

ListUsersInUserGroup.document: This API is used to get the list of the users in a user group.
ListUsersInUserGroup.name: Gets the list of users in user group

ModifyAccountGroup.document: This API is used to modify an account group.
ModifyAccountGroup.name: Modifies account group

ModifyAppAccount.document: This API is used to modify an application account.
ModifyAppAccount.name: Modifies application account

ModifyApplication.document: This API is used to update the information of an application.
ModifyApplication.name: Updates application

ModifyUserInfo.document: This API is used to modify the information of a user by username or user ID.
ModifyUserInfo.name: Modifies user

RemoveAccountFromAccountGroup.document: This API is used to remove an account from an account group.
RemoveAccountFromAccountGroup.name: Removes account from account group

RemoveUserFromUserGroup.document: This API is used to remove a user from a user group.
RemoveUserFromUserGroup.name: Removes user from user group

UpdateOrgNode.document: This API is used to create an organization node.
UpdateOrgNode.name: Updates organization node

members.document: Search criterion. You can combine multiple search criteria and search in multiple data ranges. In addition, multiple query methods such as full match, partial match, and range match are supported. Specifically, double quotation marks ("") indicate full match, an asterisk (*) at the end of the field indicates partial match, and an empty field indicates to query the full table by default.
members.name: SearchCondition

When this parameter is left empty or specified as `false`, only the information of the current organization node will be read by default. When it is specified as `true`, the information of the current organization node and its level-1 sub-nodes will be read.

members.document: Fuzzy match search criterion. You can combine multiple search criteria and search in multiple data ranges. In addition, multiple query methods such as full match, partial match, and range match are supported. Specifically, double quotation marks ("") indicate full match, and an asterisk (*) at the end of the field indicates partial match. The fuzzy match search feature and the exact match query feature will not take effect at the same time. If both `SearchCondition` and `ApplicationIdList` are specified, `ApplicationIdList` will take effect by default for exact match query; otherwise, the information of all applications will be returned by default.
members.name: SearchCondition

members.document: Organization node ID, which is globally unique and can contain up to 64 characters. If this parameter is left empty, the user information under the root organization node will be read by default.
members.name: OrgNodeId

members.document: Whether to read the information of its sub-nodes. When this parameter is left empty or specified as `false`, only the information of the current organization node will be read by default. When it is specified as `true`, the information of the current organization node and its level-1 sub-nodes will be read.
members.name: IncludeOrgNodeChildInfo

members.document: User attribute search criterion. The supported search criteria include username, mobile number, email address, user locking status, user freezing status, creation time, and last modification time, which can also be combined. In addition, multiple query methods such as full match, partial match, and range match are supported. Specifically, double quotation marks ("") indicate full match, an asterisk (*) at the end of the field indicates partial match, brackets separated by a comma ([Min,Max]) indicate query within a closed interval, braces separated by a comma ({Min,Max}) indicate query within an open interval, and a bracket and a brace can be used together (for example, {Min,Max] indicates that the minimum value is excluded and the maximum value is included in the query). Range query supports using an asterisk (for example, {20,*] indicates an interval including all data greater than 20) and querying by time period. The supported attributes include creation time (CreationTime) and last modification time (LastUpdateTime) in ISO 8601 format, such as `2021-01-13T09:44:07.182+0000`.
members.name: SearchCondition

members.document: Set of sort criteria. The supported attributes for sorting include username (UserName), mobile number (Phone), email address (Email), user status (Status), creation time (CreatedDate), and last modification time (LastModifiedDate). If this field is left empty, the results will be sorted in alphabetical order by nickname (DisplayName).

Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: LastUpdateTime

members.document:
User creation time in ISO 8601 format.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: CreationTime

members.document:
Path ID of the user's primary organization.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OrgPath

members.document:
User's mobile number with country code, such as `+86-00000000000`.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Phone

members.document:
List of IDs of the user's user groups.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SubjectGroups

members.document:
User's email address.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Email

members.document:
Last login time of the user in ISO 8601 format.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: LastLoginTime

members.document:
User ID, which is globally unique and can contain up to 64 characters.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: UserId

members.document: Username, which can contain up to 64 characters.
members.name: UserName

members.document: User's mobile number.
members.name: Phone

members.document: User's email address.
members.name: Email

members.document: User status. Valid values: NORMAL: normal; FREEZE: frozen; LOCKED: locked; NOT_ENABLED: disabled.
members.name: Status

members.document: User creation time in ISO 8601 format.
members.name: CreationTime

members.document: The user's last update time.
members.name: LastUpdateTime

members.document: Search by name. The match criteria include username and user ID.
members.name: Keyword
